intro: Aphragmus minutus, commonly known as the small fringed orchid, is a diminutive flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small, often less than a centimeter in size, and feature intricate, fringed petals. Aphragmus minutus is a rare and endangered species, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
